page.title: 16CHANGES IN PADBURY LIFE
page.content: There have been many changes within the villages in the last 20 years. To some they spell progress, to others a much valued way of life has gone for ever. In Hillesden the school has gone,the heart of the village removed. Much of the farm land is in the hands of a business consortium, however good they are to the village they bring in farm managers from outside. In Padbury the railway station, the village shop and the bakery have all gone. Worse still,in the eyes of families who have lived there for generations,in both villages, there has been an influx of 'outsiders'. It is difficult for some villagers to accept them, especially those who only come at weekends or those who do not wish to take any part in village life. Those who are prepared to join in are made to feel at home.
